Comments_List: Much of this course was review, but it was extremely helpful to have the information taught to me in a way that was very comprehensive and learnable.
I learnt the methametic basis for group theory which was very help in understanding an array of inorganic concepts.
I of course learned a lot about coordination chemistry, but the structure of the class also allowed me to learn about how I best work as well as how to best manage my time.
I do not have any complaints about this course. It was very thorough and well taught.
This was a great course, well-taught and well-organized.

There was a lot of course work relative to my other classes, so it was sometimes difficult to keep up with all of the assignments. Though I considered this a negative while taking the course, this is also what allowed me to learn about learning style and time management.
Yes, It was great way to strengthen my foundation in inorganic chemistry and in coordination chemistry.
Yes, although it is quite specific. I would definitely recommend to any inorganic/physical chemistry student!
Yes, this is a class for other higher level inorganic classes.
Yes, with the caveat that it is a time intensive course.
